page.title: 17HOUSING
page.content: Many of the houses in Kentford are about 100 years old, although there is a small modern estate called Moulton Avenue. Many of the houses are quite big and would sell at about 45,000 pounds. Lots of the houses in Moulton are modern and there is quite a big estate, although the centre of the village is much older. Between Gazeley School and the church there are private bungalows that sell at about 40,000 pounds. The atmosphere is very quiet and bungalows are the most popular type of house in the area. The most unusual house is the renovated Gazeley windmill. As the underlying rock is chalk there is a plentiful supply of flint and this was the building material used throughout the area when many of the older houses were built.
